title: PolarizationOptics
description: This is an optical filter that lets light waves of a specific polarization pass through while blocking light waves of other polarizations

Name.description: A user defined name for this Polarization Optics element

Function.description: This records whether this polarizer optics is used to generate polarized light or to analyze polarized light

Construction.description: The modality in with which this Polarization Optics is constructed

Fabrication.description: The way in with which this Polarization Optics is fabricated

Retardation.description: Retardation describes the phase shift between the polarization component projected along the fast axis and the component projected along the slow axis

MaterialName.description: This records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the glass

GlassCode.description: If available provide the international glass code. This is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and is a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its refractive index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting glass code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit glass code of 517642

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of the component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of the component

SpecsFile.description: Attach a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer

tier.description: The tier level of this component.
